docs.snippet: Shares of Acxiom Corp plunged as much as 34 percent on Thursday, after Facebook Inc said it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network.

headline.print_headline: Acxiom Shares Tank After Facebook Cuts Ties With Data Brokers
headline.main: Acxiom Shares Tank After Facebook Cuts Ties With Data Brokers

docs.snippet: India's government has sent a notice to Facebook asking whether the personal data of Indian voters and users has been compromised by U.K.-based Cambridge Analytica or any other downstream entity.

headline.print_headline: India Sends Notice to Facebook Over Alleged Data Breach
headline.main: India Sends Notice to Facebook Over Alleged Data Breach

docs.snippet: Britain's Information Commissioner welcomed Facebook's decision to end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network.

headline.print_headline: UK Information Commissioner Welcomes Facebook Move to Cut Ties to Data Brokers
headline.main: UK Information Commissioner Welcomes Facebook Move to Cut Ties to Data Brokers

docs.snippet: In the wake of the scandal sparked by Facebook's handling of 50 million users' data, Reuters polled Americans about how they are protecting their privacy online.

headline.print_headline: Poll: Are Americans Taking Steps to Protect Their Data After Facebook Scandal?
headline.main: Poll: Are Americans Taking Steps to Protect Their Data After Facebook Scandal?

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Wednesday it would end its partnerships with several large data brokers who help advertisers target people on the social network, a step that follows a scandal over how Facebook handles personal information.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Cuts Ties to Data Brokers in Blow to Targeted Ads
headline.main: Facebook Cuts Ties to Data Brokers in Blow to Targeted Ads

docs.snippet: A picture of an Afghan woman taking a university entrance exam with her baby asleep on her lap has helped her achieve her dream of going to college.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Picture Helps Afghan Woman Achieve Dream of College
headline.main: Facebook Picture Helps Afghan Woman Achieve Dream of College

docs.snippet: A Yale architect writes that the architectural element is missing from Facebook’s plan to build a real community.
First used with Bitcoin, blockchain technology could reduce the control that big internet companies have over our personal information. But it’s far from a mature technology.

headline.main: Tech Thinks It Has a Fix for the Problems It Created: Blockchain

docs.snippet: In a wide-ranging TimesTalks conversation, Mr. Holder, the former attorney general, also said Facebook should be viewed as a communication company and be regulated.

headline.print_headline: Eric Holder Says He’ll Sue to Block Citizenship Question on Census
headline.main: Eric Holder Says He’ll Sue to Block Citizenship Question on Census

docs.snippet: Here are some of our favorite recent pieces.

headline.print_headline: What You Might Have Missed: 10 Weekend Reads From Opinion
headline.main: What You Might Have Missed: 10 Weekend Reads From Opinion
